conclusion: Introduction to the problem of finding work done by the gas from state C to state D in a cyclic process.
Description of the P-V diagram axes and states A, B, C, D.
Description of the process paths A→B, B→C, C→D, D→A.
Identification of the need to find work done by the gas from C to D, an isobaric process.
Calculation of work done in an isobaric process using W = PΔV.
Calculation of ΔV from C to D as -V L.
Calculation of work done by the gas from C to D as -0.75p × 10^5 × V J.
Consideration of additional information like temperature at state A.
Exploration of ideal gas law at state A to define constants.
Decision to proceed with symbolic answer due to lack of numerical values.
Interpretation of units for the answer in joules.
Double-checking sign convention for work done by the gas.
Final answer for work done by the gas from C to D as -0.75p × 10^5 × V J.
